banner.title: Security vulnerabilities detected on your Steam account

description.paragraph1: A Steam Web API Key has been detected on your account, which can be used by a malicious actor to control your account and inventory, such as accepting or declining trade offers. It's commonly used as part of phishing attacks to steal inventories.
description.paragraph2: If you haven't registered a Steam Web API Key yourself, please first deauthorize all devices immediately.
description.paragraph3: Then revoke the Steam Web API Key.
description.paragraph4: We also recommend chaning your password as well, because the attacker will be aware of your Steam password. If you used this password else, change it on other sites as well.

steamWebApiKeyExplained.title: What is a Steam Web Api Key?
steamWebApiKeyExplained.description: Sharing your API key for trading websites is unnecessary and very risky. It's intended for developers and misusing it is like exposing your login credentials. Doing so can lead to phishing attacks and risk your Steam account being banned, violating <0>Steam Web API Terms</0>.

tradePartnerUnverified.title: Could someone be trying to scam you?

description.paragraph1: This trade offer doesn't appear to be from Skinport and we couldn't verify the trade partner.
description.paragraph2: We advise you to only continue if you trust the trade partner. You will not be able to get your items back.

description.paragraph1: This trade offer is oficially from Skinport and the trade partner is a verified Skinport bot.

content.securityProvidedBySkinportBrowserExtensi: Security provided by Skinport browser extension

checkSteamAccountSecurity.label: Check for Steam account security vulnerabilities
